Lack enough support: The claim that sunlight can kill the novel coronavirus lacks enough scientific evidence to support it.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that sunlight has not been proven to kill the novel coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that sunlight can effectively kill the virus without sufficient evidence or scientific consensus.
Exist alternative explanation: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control is unsure if sunlight or heat will affect COVID-19 in the same way, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations for the claim.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential risks or limitations associated with sunlight exposure in relation to COVID-19.
Falters at times: The claim falters in its accuracy and reliability by promoting an unverified and potentially misleading statement.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the effectiveness of sunlight in killing the novel coronavirus without substantial evidence.
